statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Hofstra 82, Towson 70
article.story: HEMPSTEAD, N.Y. (AP) -- Loren Stokes scored 23 of his 31 points in the first half and grabbed 11 rebounds to lead Hofstra to an 82-70 win over Towson Thursday. Carlos Rivera followed with 19 points, 17 in the second half, for the Pride (13-4, 6-3 Colonial), who held a 40-31 lead at halftime. Gary Neal scored a game-high 36 points to lead the Tigers (9-10, 5-5). Lawrence Hamm added 15 points and 11 rebounds. Stokes hit two jump shots as Hofstra jumped off to a 9-2 lead at 15:20 of the first half. Neal then scored nine points to spark a 12-2 run that put Towson on top 14-11 at 12:03. Hofstra used a 13-2 surge to gain a 38-25 advantage at 2:57 as Stokes scored six. The Pride took its biggest lead, 59-43, on a three-point basket by Rivera at 12:50 of the second half. Towson used a 20-7 run to close to 66-63 at 5:07. Neal had 10 points and Velmar Coleman closed the burst with two free throws. Hofstra then outscored the Tigers 9-0, as Rivera hit a 3-pointer and Antoine Agudio connected on two more, to go up 75-63.
